includeLayers.description: These layers are scale dependent and not visible below 1:10,000. These layers show predicted road flooding during annual highest tides (king tides) and mean highest high tides observed each day (MHHW) under low and high sea level rise scenarios.

includeLayers.name: Predicted Road Flooding with High Sea Level Rise
Predicted Road Flooding with Low Sea Level Rise

includeLayers.description: Possible shifts in mangrove habitat under low and high sea level rise scenarios are depicted.  The software ‘Sea Level Affecting Marshes Model’ was used to simulate future habitat in the Florida Keys as part of the GreenKeys! planning process, as sponsored by Monroe County's Sustainability Program.  These model results were used to assess the mangrove habitat change.

includeLayers.name: Mangrove Change with High Sea Level Rise - 24 in. by 2060
Mangrove Change with Low Sea Level Rise - 9 in. by 2060
